channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken glass on floor, 30th December
item.description:
Broken glass on pavement left by drunks has been there for 10 days, bigger pieces removed by pharmacy staff but they will not sweep outside, and street cleaners from Church St don’t come this way very often. Dangerous for all especially pets and children.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streatham High Road SW16 at Pendennis Road junction, 30th December
item.description:
Streatham High Road SW16 at Pendennis Road junction – north side ie Odeon Cinima (number 47 / 49) side are a couple of cycle parking hoops with a cycle frame attached – no wheels, saddle etc. This is a TfL road but under the Environmental Protection Act (EPA) Lambeth is still responsible for general street litter / rubbish. So unless I’m wrong please start the process to get this removed. Please note fixmystreet.com link for report map pin & picture & Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4322259,-0.1290699,3a,19.1y,151.16h,87.63t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1srbpf3Mxu8iuXeaMpZ_tEnA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D2.3659646493675126%26panoid%3Drbpf3Mxu8iuXeaMpZ_tEnA%26yaw%3D151.1593268547857!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTIwOS4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47-49, Streatham High Road, Streatham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fltipping still there!, 30th December
item.description:
Please do not mark as case closed - this rubbish was still here this morning. The timber hoarding needs to be reinstated by somebody and CCTV needs to be installed to discourage people. If this cannot be done, a roadsweeper needs to be sent up here on a weekly basis at a minimum.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madron Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping still there - permanent problem!, 30th December
item.description:
Once this is cleared could it be arranged to send a road sweeper down this street on a regular occurrence. As well as rubbish, numerous people use this street as a toilet and it often stinks. If only the large items are removed, the remainder of the waste remains scattered across the road, encouraging others to fly tip further - please completely clear everything. A lot of this rubbish has been here a month at least - other people are raising this as well but it's being marked as closed when it is not - I took these photos today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madron Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closed due to utility works - but drivers not stopping, 30th December
item.description:
A number of idiotic drivers are still driving down and through the bottom of Plaistow lane despite it being closed (and therefore driving on the wrong side of the road) . They are driving into legitimate traffic and it is only a matter of time before there is an accident. There are plenty of signs to say the road is closed but they are just driving on the wrong side instead. It is very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Household furniture including beds, armchsirs and mattresses dumped on Caleb Stret SE1 1EW, 30th December
item.description:
Household furniture once again being dumped on Caleb and Mint St SE1 1EW. This appears to be happening mote frequently. Area becoming a dumping site for all manner of rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Great Guildford Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Birds poo all over bench again, 30th December
item.description:
Birds are continuously pooing on this bench which Makes it totally unable to use. I am disabled and would like to sit down whilst waiting for a bus. The bus stop plastic bench is generally taken up by someone so that leaves just the bench which is badly covered in poo. Please don’t tell me this is someone else’s responsibility as I’m sick and tired of being told this. Please can someone either move the bench or cut the tree back and Clean it please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Westmoreland Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unemptied bins overflowing and flyipping, 30th December
item.description:
Veolia failed to empty all bins on Monday and the ones at the end of Crampton St are now building up and flytipping is happening. Please have these emptied asap and ask Veolia to actually complete their task on our street. They also rarely put the bins back correctly. There is also flytipping now by the food waste bin by Fareshares. Please kindly have this cleared up. Thanks so much for all you do!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Crampton Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
